answerText: J.G. Ballard [or James Graham Ballard][10] J.G. Ballard also penned this celebrated autobiographical novel, in which a young J.G. describes his childhood in Shanghai during the Japanese occupation.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 5 | 19 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: His first full length novel is essentially a collection of sketches about natural disasters, but he gained his reputation for a work about Robert Vaughan, a doctor with a fetish for getting into accident collisions. [10] Identify this dystopian novelist, whose works include The Wind From Nowhere and Crash.
